body: This sounds like its a similar area to: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/19018 where the symlink action can happen before the action that creates the linked target is executed.

Note that this issue is specifically about `--experimental_inprocess_symlink_creation`, which is not the default. (In addition, in-process just changes the mechanism through which symlinks are created, it doesn't change when they're created relative to other parts of the build).

issue.title: Handle file type changes with in-process symlink creation

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
`SymlinkTreeUpdater` now correctly replaces symlinks with directories and vice versa in runfiles trees.

Fixes #20266

issue.title: [7.2.0] Handle file type changes with in-process symlink creation

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
`SymlinkTreeUpdater` now correctly replaces symlinks with directories and vice versa in runfiles trees.

Fixes #20266

Closes #22087.

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 7.2.0 RC1](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/7.2.0rc1). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=7.2.0rc1. Thanks!
I tried `7.2.0rc1` and the issue that we were experiencing is indeed fixed there. Thank you!
